ensemble.longName: Simulation using HIRAM-C360 using future SSTs and RCP 4.5 forcing for the period 2026-2035
ensemble.description: Additional ensemble members were started by from 01 January using different years with future SST/sea-ice from two different models.

reference.name: 2.1 sst2030
reference.description: Reference to a experiment called 2.1 sst2030

reference.name: sst2030 hiram-c360
reference.description: Reference to a simulation called sst2030 hiram-c360

reference.name: sst2030 hiram-c360
reference.description: Reference to a simulation called sst2030 hiram-c360

reference.name: Sea Ice Key Properties
reference.description: Reference to a modelComponent called Sea Ice Key Properties

detail.name: ice_thickness
detail.description: Model was run in AMIP mode with SST and sea ice concentration determined from the HadISST 1.1 data set (http://hadobs.metoffice.com/hadisst/) plus a monthly mean SST and sea ice concentration anomaly computed as the difference between the GFDL-ESM2M historical and RCP4.5 experiments. The sea-ice coverage is determined by truncating the resulting future sea-ice concentration to either 0 or 1. The uniform sea-ice thickness was reduced from it's AMIP value of 2.00 meters to 1.74 meters.
Initial condition for C360 AMIP. Taken from 01 January 2024 during the 3-year spinup of a 2030 time-slice experiment using GFDL-ESM2M SSTs (r1i1p1). (See code modification sea-ice thickness ESM2M.)

detail.name: ice_thickness
detail.description: Model was run in AMIP mode with SST and sea ice concentration determined from the HadISST 1.1 data set (http://hadobs.metoffice.com/hadisst/) plus a monthly mean SST and sea ice concentration anomaly computed as the difference between the GFDL-ESM2M historical and RCP4.5 experiments. The sea-ice coverage is determined by truncating the resulting future sea-ice concentration to either 0 or 1. The uniform sea-ice thickness was reduced from it's AMIP value of 2.00 meters to 1.74 meters.
Initial condition for C360 AMIP. Taken from 01 January 2025 during the 3-year spinup of a 2030 time-slice experiment using GFDL-ESM2M SSTs (r1i1p1). (See code modification sea-ice thickness ESM2M.)

reference.name: sst2030 hiram-c360

reference.name: Sea Ice Key Properties
reference.description: Reference to a modelComponent called Sea Ice Key Properties

detail.name: ice thickness
detail.description: Model was run in AMIP mode with SST and sea ice concentration determined from the HadISST 1.1 data set (http://hadobs.metoffice.com/hadisst/) plus a monthly mean SST and sea ice concentration anomaly computed as the difference between the GFDL-CM3 historical and RCP4.5 experiments. The sea-ice coverage is determined by truncating the resulting future sea-ice concentration to either 0 or 1. The uniform sea-ice thickness was reduced from it's AMIP value of 2.00 meters to 1.23 meters.
Initial condition for HIRAM-C360 taken from the end of an AMIP run (r1i1p1).

detail.name: ice thickness
detail.description: Model was run in AMIP mode with SST and sea ice concentration determined from the HadISST 1.1 data set (http://hadobs.metoffice.com/hadisst/) plus a monthly mean SST and sea ice concentration anomaly computed as the difference between the GFDL-CM3 historical and RCP4.5 experiments. The sea-ice coverage is determined by truncating the resulting future sea-ice concentration to either 0 or 1. The uniform sea-ice thickness was reduced from it's AMIP value of 2.00 meters to 1.23 meters.
Initial condition for C360 AMIP. Taken from 01 January 2024 during the 3-year spinup of a 2030 time-slice experiment using GFDL-CM3 SSTs (r1i1p2). (See code modification sea-ice thickness CM3.)

The sea-ice coverage is determined by truncating the resulting future sea-ice concentration to either 0 or 1. The uniform sea-ice thickness was reduced from it's AMIP value of 2.00 meters to 1.23 meters.
Initial condition for C360 AMIP. Taken from 01 January 2025 during the 3-year spinup of a 2030 time-slice experiment using GFDL-CM3 SSTs (r1i1p2). (See code modification sea-ice thickness CM3.)
